qas.question: When did Southampton turn into a spa town?
Despite not having a good beach, what decade saw  Southampton become popular for sea bathing?
Where in Southampton were special baths filled by seawater constructed?
What change in flow of the sea controlled the innovative baths at West Quay?

context: Southampton became a spa town in <a0_0>1740<a0_0/>. It had also become a popular site for sea bathing by the <a1_0>1760s<a1_0/>, despite the lack of a good quality beach. Innovative buildings specifically for this purpose were built at <a2_0>West Quay<a2_0/>, with baths that were filled and emptied by the flow of <a3_0>the tide<a3_0/>.
